data.title: Image clickthrough URLs
data.meta_description: Turn your images into links to other pages or websites. Use clickthrough URLs to turn images into links to other web sites, pages on your...
data.text:
Turn your images into links to other pages or websites.

Use clickthrough URLs to turn images into links to other web sites, pages on your site, email addresses, phone numbers, or files.

Image blocks, gallery sections, and gallery blocks support clickthrough URLs on any Squarespace site. Some templates in version 7.0 support clickthrough URLs in gallery pages.

There are a number of uses for clickthrough URLs. For example:

Display a preview of a document using an image block and add a clickthrough URL that opens the .pdf file of the document.

Create a gallery of a fashion collection and add clickthrough URLs to specific products.

Note: Clickthrough URLs aren't supported on cover pages or in auto layouts.

Watch a video

Add an image

To create a clickthrough URL, first add images to your site:

Add an image block to a layout page. This adds a single image to a page.

Add a gallery section to a page. This adds a section where you can upload multiple images in a variety of layouts.

Add a gallery block to a blog post or event description. This adds a block where you can upload multiple images in a variety of layouts. In version 7.0, you can add gallery blocks to layout pages and connect them with existing gallery pages.

Tip: If you're new to Squarespace, visit Image galleries on Squarespace.

Lightboxes

Lightbox is a design effect that opens images in an overlay and dims the rest of the page when visitors click the image. Clickthrough URLs work with lightbox-enabled images, depending on where you add the image to your site. To learn more about clickthrough URLs and lightboxes, visit Setting images to open in a lightbox.

Image blocks

To add clickthrough URLs to image blocks:

Add an image block to your site, or click an existing image block.

Click the link icon in the block toolbar, or click the pencil icon to open the block editor, then click Attach Link. For some image block layouts, you need to choose On Image or On Button before Attach Link appears.

Add a web address in the URL field, or click the URL drop-down menu for more options.

To learn more about different link options, visit Adding links to your site.

Gallery sections

Gallery sections are only supported in version 7.1.

To add clickthrough URLs to images in a gallery section:

Add a page with a gallery section to your site, or click an existing page with a gallery section in your Pages panel.

Click Edit on the page.

Hover over the gallery section and click Edit gallery.

Click the image where you want to add the clickthrough URL.

In the Link field, enter a URL, or click for more options.

To learn more about different link options, visit Adding links to your site.

Gallery blocks

To add clickthrough URLs to gallery blocks with uploaded images:

Add a gallery block to your site and upload your images, or edit an existing gallery block.

Hover over the image where you want to add the clickthrough URL, and click .

Click Click to add URL... to open the link editor.

Click Content to add a link to a page on your site, click File to link to an uploaded file, or click External to add a link to a site elsewhere.

Click Save.

To add clickthrough URLs to gallery blocks connected to gallery pages, follow the gallery page steps.

To learn more about different link options, visit Adding links to your site.

Gallery pages

Gallery pages are only supported in version 7.0. If your site is on version 7.1, use gallery sections instead.

To add clickthrough URLs to images in a gallery page:

Add a gallery page to your site, or click an existing gallery page in your Pages panel.

Hover over the image where you want to add the clickthrough URL and click .

Click Options.

Click Clickthrough URL to open the link editor.

Click the icons to link to a page on your site, an external site, or an uploaded file.

Click Save.

Some templates don't support clickthrough URLs on gallery pages. If your template doesn't, the links will still work in gallery blocks and summary blocks connected to gallery pages, including project pages in the York template family.

To learn more about different link options, visit Adding links to your site.

Choose how the link opens

In image blocks, gallery sections, and grid gallery blocks, you can choose to have clickthrough URLs open on the same page or in a new tab.

In image blocks and gallery sections, switch the Open link in new tab or Open in New Window toggle on to have clickthrough URLs open in a new tab.

In grid gallery blocks, click the Design tab, scroll down, and check Open Links in New Window to have clickthrough URLs open in new tabs. This option applies to all images in the block.

In gallery pages and carousel, slideshow, and stack gallery blocks, clickthrough URLs always open on the same page.

Gallery page clickthrough URLs by template

These template families in version 7.0 support clickthrough URLs on gallery pages:

Adirondack - Yes. Slideshow design only.

Avenue - No

Aviator - Yes

Bedford - Yes

Brine - Yes

Farro - Yes

Five - Yes

Flatiron - Yes

Forte - Yes

Galapagos - Yes

Ishimoto - Yes

Momentum - No

Montauk - No

Native - Yes

Pacific - Yes

Skye - Yes

Supply - Yes

Tremont - Yes

Wells - No

Wexley - No

York - Yes. Not supported on project pages.
